links.title: Why Tesla's Cars Cost 50% More in China
links.description: Second in a series of stories about Tesla's ambitions in China Part 1: Why Tesla is Struggling in China Tesla sold just over $1 billion worth of cars in China last year, but that money bought far fewer cars than it would have in the U.S.

links.title: Tencent (TCEHY) buys a 5% stake in Tesla (TSLA)
links.description: Tesla (TSLA) was up $7 today on the news that Tencent (TCEHY) bought a 5% stake in Elon Musk's car company. Tencent bought 8.2 million shares of Tesla's shares on the open market for 1.8 billion dollars. Tencent already has investments in AI (artificial intelligence) and self-driving cars.

links.title: Tesla: Its Future in Four Tweets
links.description: Tesla's going to need a lot of batteries. As the company works to get its mass-market Model 3 out to some lucky consumers later this year, Elon Musk tweeted about what the car maker has planned next. He announced that Tesla would be unveiling an semi truck in September and a pickup truck in 18 to 24 months.

links.title: All-electric Lucid Motors 'Air' reaches 217 mph in high speed stability test
links.description: Making a grand entrance at the 117th-annual New York International Auto Show today is electric car startup Lucid Motors. The California-based maker of the "private jet on wheels" is debuting its ultra luxury Lucid 'Air' along with its Alpha Speed Car, which recently completed its first high-speed stability test at a software limited 217 mph (350km/h).

links.title: Apple has an official permit to test self-driving cars in California, DMV confirms
links.description: Apple has received a permit to test autonomous cars in California, the first official confirmation that the maker of the iPhone sees the century-old automobile as a product that's ripe for reinvention and a reflection of its need to tap new markets to sustain its growth.

links.title: Tesla Semi Truck To Be Unveiled In September
links.description: Tesla Plans a Battery-Powered Truck Source: Nikola Motor Company Elon Musk tweeted today that the Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) Semi truck unveil is set for September, calling it "seriously next level". Musk had discussed Tesla's intentions for a BEV semi last July in " Master Plan, Part Deux": In addition to consumer vehicles, there are two other types of electric vehicle needed: heavy-duty trucks and high passenger-density urban transport.

links.title: Elon Musk: Tesla to reveal pickup, semi trucks
links.description: NEW YORK - Tesla CEO Elon Musk said Thursday that the company would reveal plans for a semi-truck in September and show off a pickup truck in up to two years. The plans could shake up the red-hot American market for highly profitable pickup trucks and introduce a new wrinkle into the shipping business, which many believe is poised for a total overhaul with the onslaught of self-driving capability.
